newsitem.title: LATVIA: C.BANK MARCH GOLD, FOREIGN CURRENCY UP 0.3 PCT.
newsitem.headline: C.BANK MARCH GOLD, FOREIGN CURRENCY UP 0.3 PCT.

text.p: The central bank said on Tuesday that its gold and foreign convertible currency reserves rose by 1.4 million lats or 0.3 percent in March to 504.38 million lats.

The bank also said in a statement that its total assets came to 547.32 million lats at the end of last month. Local credits rose 3.4 million lats to 29.14 million lats due to a rise in repo and lombard operations.
The bank's foreign liabilities fell by 2.5 million lats to 140.30 million lats as it continued to pay off International Monetary Fund (IMF) credits.
Lats in circulation came to 291.83 million lats, a rise of 3.2 percent.
